exceptions.exn: In environment x, y, z : Z Unable to unify "addZ (addZ x y) z" with "addZ x (addZ y z)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
associativity Z addZ

Premises:
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
addZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => addZ x0 y = addZ y x0) (eq_sym (add_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (add_IZ_succZ y)) (fun (n0 : nat) (H : addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => succZ z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (let H0 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) := eq_refl in (fun H1 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) => eq_ind (succZ (pos n0)) (fun z : Z => succZ (addZ y (pos n0)) = addZ y z) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z =>...
add_add : forall (S : Set) (Add : S -> S -> S), commutativity S Add -> associativity S Add -> forall x1 y1 x2 y2 : S, Add (Add x1 y1) (Add x2 y2) = Add (Add x1 x2) (Add y1 y2)
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop
addpos = fix addpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => succZ x2 | S n0 => succZ (addpos x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addpos _ _%nat_scope
addneg = fix addneg (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => predZ x2 | S n0 => predZ (addneg x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addneg _ _%nat_scope
IZ = pos 0 : Z
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
add_IZ_succZ : forall x : Z, addZ x IZ = succZ x
add_mIZ_predZ : forall x : Z, addZ x (neg 0) = predZ x
addZ_eq4 : forall y : Z, addZ (neg 0) y = predZ y
addZ_eq2 : forall y : Z, addZ (pos 0) y = succZ y
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (succZ x) y = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (predZ x) y = predZ (addZ x y)
addZ_eq5 : forall (n1 : nat) (y : Z), addZ (neg (S n1)) y = predZ (addZ (neg n1) y)
addZ_eq3 : forall (n1 : nat) (y : Z), addZ (pos (S n1)) y = succZ (addZ (pos n1) y)
tech_add_pos_succZ : forall (x : nat) (y : Z), addZ (pos (S x)) y = succZ (addZ (pos x) y)
tech_add_neg_predZ : forall (x : nat) (y : Z), addZ (neg (S x)) y = predZ (addZ (neg x) y)
tech_add_pos_neg_posZ : forall n1 n2 : nat, n2 < n1 -> addZ (pos n1) (neg n2) = pos (n1 - S n2)

posOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => pos n' end : nat -> Z Arguments posOZ _%nat_scope
negOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => neg n' end : nat -> Z Arguments negOZ _%nat_scope
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z

Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
